post.author: Zasz
post.title: Nested MasterPages seems to have an egg or two
post.content:
NestedMaster Pages – Content Place Holders in <head> Issue

 

If we have a Master Page say SiteMaster.master and a content page for it say Default.aspx with a ContentPlaceHolder in the <head> section of the master page.The idea is that content pages can add their own stylesheet links. Each content page, in our example, needs a different stylesheet.

 

Okay, the issue is using Page.Header.Controls property, in the code-behind of the Default.aspx, shows only the controls in the head section of the master page SiteMaster.master. We cannot access the controls of the head that arein the content part of the content placeholder, in our Default.aspx page.

 

If we are using Nested Master Pages ,with contentplaceholders in <head> section, then Page.Header.Controls exposes only the controls in the <head> tag that must be present in the outermost, most general master page. In either of these cases, If we try to skip head altogether and define the head tag in the asp:content of the content pages, ThenPage.Header simply becomes null when accessed.

 

For unavoidable cases, I recommend writing the <head> section with all the possible Content combinations, with Visibility=”False” [means the tagwon't be rendered into the html sent to the browser] and group them like :


<head>

 

<%-- forDefault.aspx -->

<linkhref=”..” rel=”..”/ runat=”server”ID = “Def1” Visibility=”False”>

<meta ..runat=”server” ID = “Def2”/>

 

<%-- forLinkz.aspx -->

<linkhref=”..” rel=”..” runat=”server”ID = “Lin1” />

<meta .. runat=”server” ID = “Lin2” />

 

</head>

 

and then use the Page.Header.Controls as follows, in the Code-Behind of the MasterPage SiteMaster.master :

 

protected voidPage_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)

{

string check;

 

if(Request.Path.Contains(“Default.aspx”))

check = “Def”;

if(Request.Path.Contains(“Linkz.aspx”))

check = “Lin”;

//.....................etc.,

 

foreach(Controlc in Page.Header.Controls)

{

if(c.ID.StartsWith(check,StringComparison.InvariantCultureIgnoreCase))

c.Visibility =true;

}

 

}

 

Another method is by using the scriptlets as suivantes:

 

<head>

 

<%if(Request.Path.Contains(“Default .aspx”)) { %>

<linkhref=”..” rel=”..”/ runat=”server”ID = “Def1” Visibility=”False”>

<meta ..runat=”server” ID = “Def2”/>

<% }%>

 

<%if(Request.Path.Contains(“Linkz.aspx”)) { %>

<linkhref=”..” rel=”..” runat=”server”ID = “Lin1” />

<meta .. runat=”server” ID = “Lin2” />

<% }%>

 

</head>
